devdoc.author: Hvard Pedersen, B6056952.
devdoc.details: This will implement and make use of functions, events, and storages defined in its parent-contracts.

params._account: An address for whom to query the balance.

balanceOf(address).return: The number of items owned by `_owner`, possibly zero.

createItem(uint256,uint16,uint16,uint16,.details: Function to mint a new item, store it in the owners array and send out events.

params._img: the int that stores both item type and logic for what image to use.
params._owner: the address of the lucky owner of this newly minted item
params._rarity: the rarity of the new item
params._stat2: these two are the stats of the items, where they should be assigned to stat[] as follows: [_stat1, _stat2].

createItem(uint256,uint16,uint16,uint16,.return: returns the id of the new item

params._id: The item to find the approved address for.

getApproved(uint256).return: The approved address for this item, or the zero address if there is none.

params._operator: The address that acts on behalf of the owner.
params._owner: The address that owns the items.

isApprovedForAll(address,address).return: True if `_operator` is an approved operator for `_owner`, false otherwise.

params._data: Additional data with no specified format
params._from: The address which previously owned the token
params._tokenId: The NFT identifier which is being transferred

ownerOf(uint256).return: The address of the owner of the item.

params._from: The current owner of the item.
The current owner of the item.
params.data: Additional data with no specified format, sent in call to `_to`.

params._approved: True if the operator is approved, false to revoke approval.
params._operator: Address to add to the set of authorized operators.

totalSupply().return: A count of valid items tracked by this contract, where each one of  them has an assigned and queryable owner not equal to the zero address.

params._from: The current owner of the item.

upgradeItems(address,uint256,uint256,uin.details: this is the function called when upgrading items

devdoc.title: ItemOwnership is the contract that implements all ERC721 standards. This means that the contract takes care of all that has to do with ownerships.

approve(address,uint256).notice: Change or reaffirm the approved address for an item.

balanceOf(address).notice: Count all items assigned to an owner.

getApproved(uint256).notice: Get the approved address for a single item.

getItemByID(address,uint256).notice: This function can be used to iterate through all items of a user, in combination with balanceOf(_owner). This is the only way to return all items an address owns.

getItemByIndex(address,uint256).notice: This function can be used to iterate through all items of a user, in combination with balanceOf(_owner). This is the only way to return all items an address owns.

getStatInformation().notice: Returns a map of map. This should be accessed as follows: [type][value], where type is weapon type, and value is either 0 (statIncrement for stat1), 1(statIncrement for stat2), 2 (Lowest roll for stat1), 3(Lowest roll for stat2).

isApprovedForAll(address,address).notice: Query if an address is an authorized operator for another address.

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.notice: Handle the receipt of an NFT

ownerOf(uint256).notice: Find the owner of an item.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.notice: Transfers the ownership of an item from one address to another address.
Transfers the ownership of an item from one address to another address.

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).notice: Enable or disable approval for a third party ("operator") to manage  all of `msg.sender`'s assets.

totalSupply().notice: Count items tracked by this contract.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfer ownership of an item -- THE CALLER IS RESPONSIBLE  TO CONFIRM THAT `_to` IS CAPABLE OF RECEIVING itemS OR ELSE  THEY MAY BE PERMANENTLY LOST.
